Problem: Content is difficult to perceive visually due to low contrast, fixed or small text size.
User Context: Low Vision Users, Color Blind Users, Elderly

Problem: Difficult and inefficient navigation for assistive technology users.
Interface elements are not clearly identified or labeled for screen readers.
Difficulty understanding basic interactions and gestures.
Usability issues with biometric (fingerprint) authentication.
Difficult face verification process.
User Context: Screen Reader Users, Low Vision Users

Problem: Existing digital banking applications have too many unnecessary images and cannot be read well by a screen reader.
Most inspected banking applications fail to meet crucial accessibility design considerations for users with low literacy.
Voice-based interaction features are largely absent or not properly functional.
User Context: Low Literacy Users, Low Vision Users, People with Motor Impairments

Problem: Mobile banking applications are often too complex and do not support local languages.
Source: (Shridhar et al., 2025), (Naeem et al., 2022), (Wahab et al., 2021)

Problem: Complex user interfaces (UI) and poor design pose challenges for the elderly.
Users are confused by technical terms such as "digital signature," "verification," and "authentication."
Textual interfaces are not easily understood, especially by elderly and low-literacy users.
Navigation dead ends.
Concerns about application stability, such as software errors, system errors, and connectivity problems.
Slow performance, poor responsiveness, and large application size.
Bugs, functionality issues, and critical failures, often occurring after updates.
Transaction failures.
Complaints about the application being slow to respond and experiencing login issues.
The quality and functionality of the application on the Android platform are significantly worse compared to the iOS version.
Slow fund transfer times that are often inconsistent with the estimated time.
The verification process during registration frequently fails.
Unstable and unreliable infrastructure causes users to experience difficulties in accessing banking services.
Poor system performance makes banking activities impractical and prone to errors or system failures.
Excessive and irrelevant permission requests.
Non-transparent privacy policy and permission explanations.
Application is incompatible with VPNs.
Sensitive information is exposed during app switching.
Insecure password policies.
Lack of real-time fraud alert notifications.
Traditional authentication methods such as passwords and email verification are considered problematic.
The lack of "security tips" within the mobile banking interface leads to a perception of it being less secure.
Digital banking applications are considered technologically complex, with difficult interfaces, confusing navigation, long transaction flows, and overwhelming options.
User Context: Elderly, General, Screen Reader Users, Low Literacy Users
Source: (Isa et al., 2022), (Jena, 2023), (Naeem et al., 2022), (Wahab et al., 2021), (Ubam et al., 2021)

Problem: Anxiety and fear of making mistakes due to insufficient error recovery and a lack of prevention mechanisms.
The process for starting video customer service is fragmented and inefficient.
Difficult interaction on mobile view due to small touch targets and non-responsive content.
Absence of essential usability features, or features are hard to find.
Source: (Nour, 2022), (Hentati and Jallouli, 2025), (Jin and Fan, 2022), (Nadela and Yulianti, 2022)

Problem: All-or-nothing' permission control.
Cognitive barriers such as diminished memory, leading to high memory load.
Inconsistent design and terminology across the application.
Login and authentication system failures.
Disruption and difficulty keeping up due to frequent application updates.
Feeling unable to use the application independently or find solutions to problems.
Existing applications have too many steps to perform a simple transaction.
Inadequate feedback and navigation guidance in user interfaces can lead to user anxiety.
The customer service function in the application is inaccurate and inefficient.
The application lacks features related to the personalization of services.
The registration and activation process is suboptimal, requiring offline visits and external browsers.
Users experience significant difficulties in logging in, especially after a long time of inactivity.
The process of unlinking a device from a bank account is considered complicated by users.
Users experience technical issues when logging in or transacting, and face restrictive policies.
The absence of important support features like a chat function and difficulty finding contact information.
The account setup process is slow, frequently crashes, and gets stuck during identity verification.
The initial account verification process is slow.
The registration process is considered impractical and complicated.
Users often experience difficulties during the account login process.
Application updates are a source of user complaints, particularly because they often require users to log in again.
Users have difficulty understanding the tasks and actions required to complete a desired activity.
The task of transferring funds between accounts is significantly more difficult for specific user groups.
Low-literacy users have difficulties understanding fundamental interface elements like hierarchical structures, soft keys, and scroll bars.
The application lacks a live chat feature for direct communication with customer service.
The application does not provide functionality for users to download their transaction history.
Inadequate or unclear information presentation.
Privacy policy is difficult to read and understand.
Ambiguous affordance of interface elements.
The difference between mobile and desktop devices has a major impact on application development and can hinder user experience.
Users tend to ignore long descriptive texts in step indicators.
The display of ad banners at the bottom of the application is perceived as spam and disrupts the user experience.
Information displayed in the mobile banking app is considered insufficient and not detailed enough compared to the online banking (desktop) version.
The small screen size of mobile phones hinders clear information visibility for elderly users.
The amount of information displayed in online banking (desktop) is considered overwhelming (information overload) by some elderly users.
Text-heavy user interfaces (UIs) are perceived as daunting and are often avoided by low-literacy users.
The application is considered uninspired, monotonous, and conventional.
